reviewText: A part of the first season of Sam and Max point-and-click adventure game, the fourth episode is avaliable in Steam for free for you to try out.\nSam and Max is usual adventure game with humor, with most puzzles making sense... yet you are probably going to spend time guessing what exactly you are supposed to do, like in most games if such kinds. Hell, single episode there may last for few hours if you have no idea what to do, or you may just get stuck if you never had experience playing adventure games before.\nAs for the episode that is given to us, I can say that it has quite interesting concept/idea in this one, being related around Politics theme, first objective being punching president out of hypnotism, with more to come after that (with some nice music... tihi). It has enough content in it for me to say that you should try and beat this episode. Who knows, maybe you will like it enough to get the whole season pack?

reviewText: The words that come into my mind when I think of Sam & Max would be as follows, Classic, Crude, Comedy, Fun, Old. Those words might mean something different for you but for me it means that the Sam and Max games (S&M) are fun games made after a classic series. There is one waf to tell for certain if you like the games, you could play this one. For the now cheap price of completley free you can play through Sam and Max: Able Lincoln Must Die to see if you like it. If you dont there is no harm done, if you do like it however there will be much harm done, atleast to your free time because you will be playing the Sam and Max series (maybe). So play this, afterall there is no harm in trying it.

reviewText: This game has great characters, dialogue, and the art style is a nice change of pace from other games. It's satyrical dialogue is wonderful and seperates it from the rest of the point-and-click style games that are out there. The only problem I have with the game is that the objectives seem fairly unrelated. This is my first Sam and Max game so maybe it's the style of the series that I'm missing, but the constant back-and-forth jumping between areas and activation of obscure points seem vaguely and loosely strung together. I fail to see the relationship between a decent amount of the objectives here. Not all of them- but more than a couple. Without a walkthrough I'd be lost in this. Other games in the genre at least have a box for obtaining more clues, I have yet to find this detail in the game but it'd definitely help. Like I said, maybe it's just me (the majority of reviews here are very positive) but this game doesn't feel as smooth as other Telltale games (i.e. Walking Dead, Back To The Future). I'm a fan of Telltale and everything else going on in the game, but I wouldn't recommend this one to a first-time player in this genre.

reviewText:
Not sure what happened on this episode, but this is by far the worst one in the series.
Unlike other bad point n' click adventure games, I enjoyed Sam & Max series because the puzzles were clever, funny and logical in a way the players would be able to figure out.
However, towards the last part of the game, Sam & Max 104 suffers from random puzzle solutions that simply don't make sense, and the game requires the players to move from one visited location to the other visited location so often repeatedly on top of already terrible and slow controls.
However, the humor was still present and aside from mentioned flaws teh game was enjoyable.

Sam and Max are pure win.

This part of the first Sam & Max Telltale adventure series is released for free, to draw in potential buyers. And in my case, it worked.

Basically, Sam (a talking dog) & Max (a talking bunny thing) are Freelance Police who use any means neccessary to solve ever-more ridiculous cases. LucasArts worked with Steve Purcell (the guy who drew the original comics) to create an adventure game back in the 90's named Sam & Max Hit the Road, which was excellent. Plans for a sequel were canned, but Telltale Games took up the mantle around 2007 and worked with him to create more games. Which, if you were wondering, are also pretty good.

They've created 3 'seasons' so far, and I've played through the first two. The writing is generally good (not to mention funny!), the puzzles IMO are great, and the interface is a bit sparse in the first series but improved in the second. If you're wondering what sort of adventures the Freelance Police get up to, in this particular 'episode' Max becomes the President of the US and has to fight an animated statue of Abraham Lincoln, hence the title. I'd rather not spoil any more; if you wish to see what happens (and how) I would like to remind you once more that this particular episode is free.
THE FREELANCE POLICE ARE BACK!\nGet the full episode for FREE NOW!

Sam & Max is a very good and funny game to enjoy. If you want an easy, interactive and less violent, but fun game. This is it and it’s free! It's even better if you get the whole collection and play through it. :)

It's a free point and click adventure game from Telltale games.  It's an episode similar to a Saturday morning cartoon where you see your characters through to the end and quite easily forget what happened along the way.  The actual length of the game is mostly made up of going back and forth from one place to another and actually thinking what else you could have missed.\n\nIt's free anyways and finishing it is the best achievement I can get out of the experience.
Sam & Max are great. If you don't already own any of their new adventure games, download this and try it out. IT IS FREE! Hopefully, you will enjoy it as much as I did, and buy all the seasons.
Free Episode of Sam & Max  Try it and Buy Sam & Max Collection
Sam & Max 104: Abe Lincoln Must Die! is a really good graphical adventure, full of hilarious dialogue between the main characters. It's free, so you can try it for yourself and see if you like it.

Any Sam and Max game is as good as any... Just depends whether or not you like the furry Dog and rodent - Err Rabbit Sam, okay little buddy! Wait, that sounds... incredibly mean *whines*.

So what is Sam and Max? Or rather Sam & Max? This is one of my favourite point and click games that I like jumping up and down for... it has all I want in a game: Humor, interesting characters and walking... except Syberia: EWW!

Whilst some of you might be put off by it's childish graphics and it's oh so cute look at the pretty dog and rabbit causing antics in the street isn't it precious? Awwwwww! Awwwww! Awwwwwww!

i'll be here playing the whole series and not regretting one moment, just goes to show you a game doesn't need good graphics to get someone hooked - however it still will make people argue over what's a good or bad game... I would recommend them all if I could: but since I can't without looking like a Sam & Max enthuiast I'll just recommend this one since it has a catchy song in it! :D

If you've never played a Sam and Max game before - or any point-and-click games in general - you might as well try this out. It's free, yanno. And it's probably the best (read: funniest) episode from the first season.
